alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 11 at 2:19PM MDT until October 12 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches with locally higher amounts of up to 18 inches in the Upper Cottonwoods. The High Uintas could see up to 14 inches of snow. * WHERE...Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 and Western Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected, especially for the Cottonwood Canyons and across high elevation seasonal routes such as Monte Cristo and the Mirror Lake Highway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Hikers, hunters, campers and other recreationalists in the backcountry should be prepared for winter conditions with accumulating snow across the northern mountains this afternoon through Thursday afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx.

area.areaDesc: Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains
